29 July 2014

Shell shortcuts to boost your productivity

I have been using these small shell shortcuts lately and I like them a lot. The best part about them is that you don't have to use the awkwardly placed cursor keys. I have tested them only in rxvt and xterm on Linux so and I am not sure if they work in all terminal emulators.

Get previous command

Ctrl-p (same as ↑)

Get next command

Ctrl-n (same as ↓)

Execute previous command again

Ctrl+pj (same as ↑ and Return)
or
Ctrl+po (same as ↑ and Return and ↑)

Get the last argument of the previous command

Alt+.

Undo deletion of characters one by one:

Ctrl+-
